intro: Tococa formicaria var. gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's tococa, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. It is a climbing plant belonging to the Malvaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in humid, shaded environments within the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
